p: Figure 1 shows that the ABTS scavenging activity of the extracts and standards had an increasing trend as concentrations increased ( P < 0.05). At the maximum concentration (0.08 mg/mL), the highest % mean inhibition was produced by rutin, BHT and ethanol extract (100 %) followed by methanol (97.52 %), acetone (96.71 %) and aqueous extract (69.36 %). The concentration required to scavenge 50 % of the radicals (IC 50) was in the following order: rutin > BHT > ethanol extract > methanol extract > acetone extract > aqueous extract ( Table 2).
